intro: Cantharospermum barbatum, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in open areas such as roadsides and disturbed soils. The plant has some medicinal uses in traditional systems and is also used for ornamental purposes.
